greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Symmetric square table of coefficients, read by antidiagonals, where T(n,k) is the coefficient of x^n*y^k in f(x,y) that satisfies f(x,y) = 1/(1-x-y) + xy*f(x,y)^2.
comment: Determinants of upper left n X n matrices results in A086619: {1,2,10,150,7650,1438200,1051324200,...}, which is the products of the first n terms of the binomial transform of Catalan numbers (A007317): {1,2,5,15,51,188,731,2950,...}.
formula: Regarded as a number triangle read by row, columns are generated by sum{j=0..k, C(k,j)*A000108(j)*x^j}*x^k/(1-x)^(k+1). (End)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jul 24 2003
